name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On August 23, South Africa's presidential media director @AthiGeleba posted a Tik Tok video
In the video, Chinese President Xi Jinping watched a Chinese cultural performance in South Africa.
After the performance, Xi Jinping asked: "Is this a Chinese drum? Who did you learn it from?"
The guide replied, "Hello, President. We are Fo Guang Shan Nan Hua Temple in Taiwan. We specialize in promoting the spread of Chinese culture in various countries. This drum is specially trained by coaches in China and Taiwan."
Xi Jinping responded: "Taiwan, Taiwan invited us."
Previously, many international brands and artists were boycotted by Chinese official media and the public for listing "Taiwan" and "China" side by side, but it is clear that the President himself does not mind this.

The head of the senior class of Zhumadian No. 1 High School had an argument with a parent who delivered meals to students and started swearing
It is reported that because the food safety situation in the senior class of the school (west campus) is worrying, and the meals can be eaten with teething, plastic bags, cloth strips, etc., parents choose to deliver meals to their children themselves, and the head of the class accused the parents of "disturbing public order."

content:
On August 24, the discharge of nuclear waste water from Fukushima officially began, which caused an uproar on the Chinese Internet. Under the collective efforts of the official media, the Chinese people fell into a panic as if they were counting down to the end of the world.
Why do I say that this is a public opinion war launched by the Chinese official media?
https://t.co/1QE0mtJC6S
Is the discharge of nuclear waste water from Fukushima the end of the world or a public opinion war? [Teacher Li is not your teacher]
